(Simplified: 抠)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 區 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 區 [ qū ] area, district, region, ward; surname
①用手指或細小的東西挖。
②向狹窄的方面探求、探究：摳字眼兒。死摳書本。
③雕刻(花紋)：摳鏡框的花邊。
④吝嗇：摳門兒。
摳字眼 [ kōu zì yǎn ]: to be fastidious about phrasing, diction, or choice of words
摳門兒 [ kōu mén r ]: (dialect) stingy
摳字眼兒 [ kōu zì yǎn r ]: erhua variant of 抠字眼
(Simplified: 抠)

Pictophonetic: 區 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
Hanzi: 抠

Original meaning 本义: Meaning to lift up.

English senses 英语理解: raise, lift up; tight-fisted

Usage example 用法举例: 摳門兒 kōu mén ér (stingy)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 3519

Shuowen 说文解字: 繑也有曰摳衣升堂從手區聲

Compound 摳 from hand-left 扌 shǒu and phonetic district (区)區 qū simp 抠.

摳字的基本解释

摳
kōu
见“抠”。

摳字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kōu］
［《廣韻》恪侯切，平侯，溪。］
［《廣韻》豈俱切，平虞，溪。］
“抅2”的被通假字。“抠1”的繁体字。
(1)提起。
(2)探取，投掷。指藏钩之戏。
(3)锁拿，捆绑。
(4)挖，掏。
(5)眼窝凹进。
(6)钻研；向一个狭窄的方面探求。
(7)吝啬。
[②]［ōu］
［《集韻》於口切，上厚，影。］
同“毆1”。“抠2”的繁体字。
叩击。

摳字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　摳； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页451第24
【唐韻】口侯切【集韻】【韻會】墟侯切【正韻】驅侯切，?音彄。【說文】繑也。一曰摳衣升堂。【廣韻】挈衣也。【禮·曲禮】摳衣趨隅。【註】摳，提也。　又探也。【列子·黃帝篇】以瓦摳者巧，以鉤摳者憚，以黃金摳者惛。【註】以手藏物，探而取之。　又【揚子·方言】摳，揄旋也。秦晉樹稼早成熟謂之旋，燕齊之閒謂之摳揄。【集韻】或作挎。　又【唐韻】豈俱切【集韻】【韻會】?于切，?音區。亦褰裳也。　又【集韻】於口切。與毆同。捶擊物也。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kōu］
["Guangyun" Kehouqie, Pinghou, Xi. ]
["Guangyun" Qi Juqi, Pingyu, Xi. ]
"抅2" was passed falsely. Traditional Chinese characters for "Put 1".
(1) Lift up.
(2) Exploring and throwing. Refers to the play of hidden hooks.
(3) Lock, take, and bind.
(4) Dig, dig.
(5) The eye socket is recessed.
(6) Research; explore a narrow aspect.
(7) Stingy.
[②] [ōu]
["Ji Yun" cut in the mouth, thick and shadow. ]
Same as "Beat 1". The traditional characters of "Put 2".
Tap.
Pull
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Mao Collection] [Hands and Words Department] 　 pull; Kangxi strokes: 15; page number: page 451 24
[Tang Yun] Kou Hou Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Xu Hou Qi [Zheng Yun] To drive Hou Qi,? [Said Wen] You Ye. One said to pull the clothes into the hall. [Guang Yun] Wearing clothes. 【Rite·Curly】Crossing clothes in a corner. [Note] Pull, mention also.　Explore again. 【Liezi·Huangdi】The tile is clever, the hook is horrified, and the gold is horrified. [Note] Hidden objects by hand, explore and take them.　[Yangtze Dialect] To pull out, to whirl. The early maturity of the trees in the Qin and Jin Dynasties is called the spin, and the leisure of the Yanqi is called the dull. [Ji Yun] Or as a shoulder.　 [Tang Yun] Qi Yu Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui]? Yu Qi, the sound area. Yiying clothes also.　 [Ji Yun] cut in the mouth again. Same with assault. Thumping objects also.
